107-d-09-15-09-KXHR.Reporting Railroad Name: Knoxville & Holston River Railroad Company, Inc.
107-d-09-15-09-KXHR.Primary Accident Cause: Spring Switch not cleared before reversing
107-d-09-15-09-KXHR.Accident Cause: Spring Switch not cleared before reversing
107-d-09-15-09-KXHR.Narrative: CREW DID NOT MANUALLY THROW AND LOCK SPRING SWITCH FOR SWITCHING MOVEMENT. TRAIN WAS BEING SHOVED THROUGH SPRING SWITCH BUT DID NOT CLEAR THE SWITCH BEFORE TRAIN WAS INSTRUCTED BY CONDUCTOR TO STOP AND PULL BACK AHEAD. THIS MOVE CAUSED THE TRAIN TO SPLIT THE SWITCH AND IN TURN CAUSED 8 CARS TO DERAIL. POOR COMMUNICATION BETWEEN ALL MEMBERS OF THE TRAIN CREW (CONDUCTOR, BRAKEMAN AND ENGINEER) WAS ALSO A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR. A TOTAL OF 8 TANK CARS LOADED WITH ETHANOL (ALCOHOLN.O.S.) DERAILED AND WERE DAMAGED. TRAIN CONSISTED OF 77 LOADED TANK CARS, 1 EMPTY SPACERE CAR AND 3 LOCOMOTIVES. SEVERALCARS WERE OVERTURNED WHICH CAUSED THE RELEASE OF PRODUCT OUT OF ONE CAR. NO FIRES WERE CAUSED ADN SPILL WAS MAINTAINED. NO INJURIES RESULTED FROM THIS ACCIDENT. KXHR TRAIN WAS BEING OPERATED AS A KXHRMOVE ON NORFOLK SOUTHERN PROPERTY. ACCIDENT DATE WAS 9-15-2009.
107-d-09-15-09-KXHR.Reporting Parent Railroad Company Name: Knoxville & Holston River Railroad Company, Inc.

645282-d-09-05-09-GTW.Narrative: M39331-04 WAS OPERATING AT 22 MPH IN THE 4TH NOTCH WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY ON CWR MAIN TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR INSPECTED THE TRAIN AND FOUND CARS ITLX 41398 AND CNA 385995 DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE BRAKE PIN FELL OUT OF THE B-END OF THE ITLX 41398 CAUSING THEBOTTOM ROD TO FALL AND DRAG CATCHING ON THE LEAD WHEEL AND DERAIL THE CAR AND CNA 385995.  THE FIRST POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS ON THE THOROUGHFARE TRACK AT MILEPOST 265.2 WHILE THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELINGAT 13 MPH.  THE TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING AT 22 MPH THRU THE TURNOUT AND ONTO THE MAIN LINE WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CAR HAD BEEN PULLED APPROXIMATELY 1.5 MILES WITH THE DRAGGING ROD.

QR43600-d-09-23-09-SGSC.Primary Accident Cause: Derail, failure to apply or remove

QR43600-d-09-23-09-SGSC.Accident Cause: Derail, failure to apply or remove
QR43600-d-09-23-09-SGSC.Narrative: CONDUCTOR ACTIVATED FIXED DETAIL TO SECURE TRACK FOR LOCOMOTIVE MAINTENANCE.  USE OF THIS FIXED DERAIL WAS IN VIOLATION OF RAILROADS SPECIAL INSTRUCTION #6 AND DID NOT PROVIDE ADEQUATE PROTECTION TO THE LOCOMOTIVE MECHANIC.  THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO NOTIFY THE ENGINEER THAT HE HAD ACTIVATED THE DERAILS.  AFTER THE LOCOMOTIVE HAD BEEN COMPLETED THE CREW (ENGINEER, CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEMAN) RETURNED TOWORK.  THE FIRST MOVE WAS TO THE SOUTH TO COUPLE INTO 22 CARS ON TRACK 218.  AFTER COUPLING, THE CONDUCTOR MADE A CUT AT CAR 18 OF THE STRING.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN RADIOED THE ENGINEER TO PULL THE CONSIST TO THE NORTH TO CLEAR THE TRACK 20 SWITCH.  THE CONDUCTOR REMAINED AT THE BOTTOM END OF THE MOVEMENT AND THE BRAKEMAN WAS POSITIONED AT THE THE TRACK 20 SWITCH.  A 10 CAR COUNT WAS GIVEN FOR THEPULLING MOVE WITH THE ENGINEER POSITIONED AT THE LEADING END OF THE MOVEMENT.  THE ENGINEER FAILED TO RECOGNIZE THE ACTIVATED DERAIL.  AFTER  TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY 4 CAR LENGTHS, THE LOCOMOTIVE STRUCK THE DERAIL.  THE MOVEMENT CONTINUED AN ADDITIONAL 180 FEET.  THE 2ND CAR IN THE CONSIST, CPCX 805042, WAS DERAILED.  THE 3RD CAR IN THE CONSIST, GOCX 58710, WAS ALSO DERAILED.  WHEN GOCX 58710 BEGAN TO ROCK AND TIP OVER, CPCX 805042 WAS PULLED OVER, FOLLOWED BY LOCOMOTIVE GMTX 2002.  LOCOMOTIVE GMTX 2002 TO LEAK FUEL FROM THE FUEL TANK VENT.  GMTX 2002 IS A GP-38 WITH 3000 GALLON CAPACITY TANK.A VACUUM TRUCK TRANSFERRED 2,500 GALLONS OF FUEL FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE AFTER THE INCIDENT.  CALCULAT

092509-d-09-25-09-MAUP.Narrative: ENGINEER AND SWITCHMAN WERE PULLING IN 5 LOADED BOXCARS FOR DELMONTE.  ABOUT 3/4'S AWAY AROUND PINEYPT. CURVE, THE 3RD CAR IN THE CONSIST, DERAILED ONE TRUCK.  THE B-END L-3, L-4 , R-4, R-3 WERE ON THE GROUND ABOUT 313 FT.  THE BOXCAR NUMBER WAS ALY 500640.  THE ENGINE, THE 1ST, 2ND, 4TH, AND 5TH CAR CAME THRU THIS AREA STILL ON THE RAIL.  THE RAILCAR WAS RERAILED BY PORT MANATEE AND THE TRACK REPAIRED.  THE BOXCAR WAS PUT ON AMERICA TRACK TO HAVE A WHEEL SET CHANGED OUT AND ROLLER BEARING CHANGE.  PER AAR RULES, THE WHEELS ON THE RAILCAR WERE LOW.  AFTER INVESTIGATIONS IT WAS FOUND THAT THEWHEELS OF THE CAR DERAILED AT A VERY KINKED AND FLAT AREA ON THE LOWSIDE OF THE CURVE.  ABOUT 15' WEST OF THE DERAILMENT WEST (IN THE DIRECTION OF MOVEMENT) THERE WAS VERY TIGHT GAGE 55 1/2".  THIS TIGHT GAGE AND KINKED/FLAT RAIL SEEMED TO JUST POP THE WHEELS OF THIS ONE TRUCK UP AND OFF THE TRACK.THE EQUIPMENT DAMAGE PRICE ESTIMATE COULD BE MORE IF THERE ARE ANY NON-RECLAIMABLE PARTS (IE BROKENBEARINGS, BENT AXLE ASSEMBLIES) AFTER INSPECTION.

D531409-d-09-05-09-SLWC.Narrative: WHILE PULLING 25 EMPTY SAND CARS OUT OF TRACK 4 IN NORTH YARD, THE NEXT TO LAST CAR (KO 6224) LEAD WHEEL ON B END DERAILED BY CLIMBING THE RAIL. THE WHEEL TRAVELED 144' THEN HIT THE #3 SWITCH STAND WHICH CAUSED THE TRUCK TO COME OUT FROM UNDER THE CAR. THIS CAUSED THE CAR AND THE TWO IN FRONT OF ITTO TURN OVER ON THEIR SIDES. THE REAR CAR (SKOL 1078) HAD SOME DAMAGE TO A CORNER SUPPORT AND GRAB IRONS. WE TOOK ALL MEASUREMENTS ACCORDING TO THE FORM IN THE FIELD MANUAL AND FOUND NOTHING ON THE TRACK SIDE. WE LOOKED AT THE DOWNLOADS AND FOUND NOTHING DUE TO TRAIN HANDLING. WE INSPECTED THE CARSSEVERAL TIMES AFTER THEY WERE RE REAILED AND FOUND KO 6224 TO HAVE EXCESSIVE CENTER BOWL EAR PER BILL MISKELL. THERE WERE NO INJURIES

09203-d-09-10-09-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
09203-d-09-10-09-URR.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
09203-d-09-10-09-URR.Narrative: 50C CREW USING A TRIPLE UNIT CONSIST PULLED 22 LOADS OF SLABS SOUTH THROUGH TRACK #B-2 AT IRVIN.  CREW COUPLED LOCOMOTIVE TO 22 EMPTIES CARS ON TRACK I-34.  CREW REVERSED MOVEMENT NORTH, PULLING THE 22 EMPTIES; AT THE SAME TIME, THEY WERE SHOVING THE 22 SLAB AND CABOOSE C-103 BACK NORTH THROUGH B-2.DURING THIS NORTHWARD MOVEMENT, A LOAD OF SLAB, APEX 887 THE 21ST CAR FROM THEIR LOCOMOTIVES DERAILED AT THE B-2 SWITCH SOUTH END, CAR WAS SHOVED NORTH THROUGH B-2 AND RE-RAILED ITSELF AT THE B-3 SWITCH (NORTH END OF YARD).  INVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT DISCOVERED A PIECE OF SCRAP WAS WEDGED BETWEEN THE SIDE FRAME AND R-4 WHEEL OF APEX 887.  DURING THE SWITCHING MANEUVERS, THE PIECE OF SCRAP SHIFTED, RESTRICTING TRUCK FROM SLEWING AND CAUSING THE WHEELS OF THIS AXLE TO BE FORCED TO THE B-3 SIDE OF RAIL. THESE FORCES RESULTED IN THE L-4 WHEEL PD APEX 887 TO CLIMB THE SWITCH POINT OF THE B-2SWITCH SOUTH END AND DERAIL.

0909FW004-d-09-02-09-UP.Narrative: YFW30R-01 WAS PULLING CARS OUT OF TRACK 107 TO 108.  TRAIN ENTERED THE CIRCUIT OF #1 SWITCH UNDER HULEN.  SWITCH LINED UNDER LEAD LOCOMOTIVE OF YFW30R-01 CAUSING TRAIN TO STRIKE YFW34R-01 IN TRACK 215.  IMPACT CAUSED CARS AND LOCOMOTIVES TO DERAIL.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED CREW DID NOT CHECK TO SEE IF SWITCH HAD LOCKED.

644916-d-09-01-09-WC.Narrative: L52681-01 WAS SWITCHING ON THE SOUTH END OF OSHKOSH YARD WHEN CREW KICKED UTLX 641903 TO TRACK 13.AFTER THE CONDUCTOR HEARD THE CAR STRIKE THE NEXT CAR IN TRACK, HE LINED THE SWITCH AND MOVED HIS TRAIN PAST THE SWITCH. M662109-d-09-29-09-ABS.Narrative: KCS YARD INSTRUCTED THE ABS TO COME DOWN TRACK 13 WITH INBOUND, CUT OFF, AND COUPLE INTO THE TEN CARS SITTING ON THE LEAD.” AFTER THEY COMPLETED THIS MOVE, THE KCS YARD CONDUCTOR GOT UP ON THE ABSR LOCOS TO CONDUCT A JOB BRIEFING WITH ALL CREWS. KCS CONDUCTOR, GAVE THE ABSR 222 THEIR TRAIN LIST ANDINSTRUCTED THEM TO RUN UP THE PEAVINE AND GET ON 101 CARS IN TRACK 11 AND THIS WOULD BE THEIR OUTBOUND. THEN WHILE HEADING TOWARD THE PEAVINE, BOTH THE ABS 222 ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR NOTICED TRACK 11WAS SITTING BETWEEN A SET OF TRUCKS TO A HALF A CAR OVER THE MARKED CLEARANCE POINT. THEY CONTINUEDTO THE EAST END OF YARD, WHERE THEY DID AS INSTRUCTED AND COUPLED TO TRACK 11. AFTER MAKING COUPLINGTO TRACK 11, CONDUCTOR INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STRETCH COUPLE (WHICH SHOWED TO BE 13 SECONDS ATUP TO 695 AMPS TO STRETCH SLACK OUT OF TRACK), AND THEN ASKED FOR RED ZONE. THE ENGINEER REPLIED REDZONE SET UP, THIS WAS FOLLOWED BY KCS ATM INSTRUCTING OVER THE RADIO “ABS GET OFF THE RADIO AND LETCONSOLE 6 GIVE A TRACK WARRANT.” WHILE THE CONDUCTOR HAD RED ZONE HE PROCEEDED TO CUT THE AIR IN AND KNOCK OFF THREE HANDBRAKES FROM THE TOP OR EAST END AND STARTED WALKING TO THE REAR OF TRAIN TO START THE AIR BRAKE TEST. IT WAS AT THIS TIME THE KCS SWITCHER CAME OVER THE RADIO STATING "NOT TO MOVE" AND AT THAT TIME IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE INCIDENT HAD OCCURED.
